replies.body:
The problem with straight up assassin champs in LoL is solo q.

It's hard enough to get people to group as 5... let alone actually deal with countering an assassin. Usually what ends up happening is the team takes the assassin one at a time and gets wiped.

One guy gets caught out... deleted. Another guy is nearby and thinks he can help... deleted. The remaining 3 players all rush in to try and do something.... the opposing team comes in and CC's them... assassin then proceeds to delete, delete, delete. GG.

It's not about Katarina's ult at all. She doesn't even need it if she gets a couple levels ahead of everyone.

While I understand that fed champs are a problem in general... fed assassin's are the biggest problem.

You ever see a fed Master Yi? Yeah, that game is over in solo q. I've watched a Yi literally dive people under turret no problem and barely even take a scratch of damage. He's basically impossible to outrun once he is fed... so he just runs all over the place picking off people until the team surrenders. Something just needs to be done about these snowball champs that can fight through the entire team without a care. Like... limit their resources or something so they can only kill 1-2 people like that before they have to slow down and actually be cautious about continuing.

But right now it's like "YAY I GOT A KILL. NO STOPPING ME NOW! WEEEEEEEE!!!!" and then you just faceroll the keyboard until you get an ace.
True. Idk if the assassins are hard to control but you see, always, if someone is fed, they'd be an assassin.

Assassins are only there to do damage, and all of them snowball. Kat is no better than any other assassin in terms of snowballing. Also this game isn't and shouldn't be balanced around solo q. She is fine and has clear strengths and weaknesses. Assassins are opprotunists and exploit windows yi has been easy to deal with since season one lol. Exhuast when he goes in, he will either back off or use his w. Cc him him then blow him up. Saying nerf "x" champion because player "a" punished player "b" for making a mistake is a poor argument in my opinion.

Really the only thing I'm disliking about this game is for some champs to have the ability to completely erase an ENTIRE team by themselves if not stopped.

Seriously... it's really broken and I know the only reason they allow it is for those "big LCS plays" because it's thrilling to watch one player jump from target to target, cleaning house. Hence the announcers getting super excited when tristana is literally jumping from target to target, finishing them off for quadra/penta kills...

It's like they designed certain champs exactly to get penta kills

Katarina had so many big LCS plays in worlds this year ;) seriously though all her damage is tied to her ult. Look at the ratios and bases for all of her abilities, they are pathetic. Her 1 damage ability is the easiest move in the game to interrupt. If skill shots are too hard take targeted cc then blow her up ezpz. The old kat was way scarier, reworked kat is too easy to shut down

Seriously, build some CC vs Kat and save it for the ult.  It's simple as that.  Last night in ARAM I saved my fear as Fiddle for any time she decided to ult.  She Shunpo's in and starts to ult, I fear and then drain.  Dead Kat.

And as for the OP, yes Fizz is one of those champs like Akali, Yasuo, few others that if they get rolling they're going to be a nightmare.  That's their nature all around.  They are weak early, and if you let them start racking up kills they just snowball out of control.  Key is to know this going in and get your jungler or other lanes to help you make sure they are only completing their 3rd item by 30 minutes.  Fizz with Zhonyas, boots and a NLR at 25 minutes is not very scary.  Fizz with Zhonyas, boots, LichBane, Rabbadon's, etc... at 25 minutes is like some hellish fever dream.

Only problem is, Fizz isn't weak once he hits level 3.  That's all he needs then he can beat a lot of champs, and at 6, forget it.  Yas at least needs levels and an item.  Yas recovers from a loss lane far better, though.  It's almost like riot's main concern is to balance the OP champs with one another, then fuck the rest, we'll just lift them in their own "tier."  I put "tier" in quotes because people insist this game is balanced.  If niche counter selects somehow got a super boost that roaming assassin could not deal with, fine...but nothing truly counters an assassin if you know what I mean.
